title: Generic Platform Coding agent with Claude Sonnet
description:
Build a generic platform coding agent powered by Claude Sonnet that can assist with platform engineering tasks including code generation, code review, refactoring, and automated fixes across the codebase.

## Goals
- Create a versatile coding agent using Claude Sonnet as the LLM backbone
- Enable intelligent code generation and modification capabilities
- Support multi-file operations and codebase understanding
- Integrate with existing platform engineering workflows

## Scope
- Agent implementation using LangGraph/LangChain
- Claude Sonnet integration with proper prompt engineering
- Tool implementations for file operations, code analysis, and execution
- Context management for large codebases
- A2A protocol compliance for multi-agent communication

## Success Criteria
- Agent can understand and navigate the codebase
- Agent can generate, modify, and refactor code following project conventions
- Agent integrates with existing multi-agent supervisor system
- Agent handles context windows efficiently for large operations

title: Create shareable chat links using MongoDB
description:
Allow users to share their conversations via unique links stored in MongoDB.

Features:
- Generate unique shareable links for conversations
- Store conversation data in MongoDB
- Public view of shared conversations (no auth required)
- Copy link to clipboard functionality
- Optional: Set expiration for shared links
- Optional: Toggle share on/off per conversation

title: Sync beads with GitHub Issues
description:
Create bidirectional sync between beads and GitHub Issues on https://github.com/cnoe-io/ai-platform-engineering

## Requirements
- Export beads to GitHub Issues
- Import GitHub Issues to beads  
- Map beads priority (P1/P2) to GitHub labels
- Map beads type (epic/task) to GitHub labels
- Map beads status to GitHub issue state (open/closed)
- Link beads ID to GitHub Issue for tracking

## Approach
Use GitHub CLI (gh) or GitHub API to sync issues.

title: Handle SSO token expiry gracefully in UI
description:
When SSO token expires, the UI continues to send expired token to backend, resulting in 401 errors. Need to:
- Check token expiry before API calls
- Gracefully prompt user to relogin when token is expired
- Clear session and redirect to login page
- Show user-friendly message about session expiration

title: Fix multi-agent synthesis - streaming output shows all agents
description:
When multiple agents are invoked, the supervisor now properly creates a summary using streamed data from all agents instead of only showing the last agent response.

Root cause: sub_agent_complete boolean blocked ALL streaming after first agent.
Fix: Replace with sub_agents_completed counter and prioritize supervisor synthesis for multi-agent scenarios.

GitHub Issue: #667
GitHub PR: #669

title: A2A Streaming Improvements
description: Epic for improving A2A protocol streaming capabilities, thread management, and multi-turn conversation support across the agent hierarchy.

title: Investigate thread_id preservation across agent hierarchy
description: Investigate whether thread_id is properly preserved when messages flow from user_client -> supervisor -> sub-agent. This is critical for multi-turn conversations to maintain context and allow follow-up questions. Verify the thread_id propagation at each hop and document any gaps or fixes needed.

title: Investigate Claude thinking messages in streaming responses
description: Investigate how Claude 'thinking' messages (e.g., 'I'll search the knowledge base...', 'Let me find...') appear in A2A streaming responses. Determine how to filter or suppress these intermediate thinking messages so users only see the final substantive response. Related to the strip_thinking_messages implementation in a2a-slackbot-connector.

title: Fix A2A streaming output duplication
description: Fix duplicate content appearing in A2A streaming responses.

Define: Library-First Principle, CLI Interface Mandate, Test-First Imperative, Simplicity Gates, Anti-Abstraction Rules, Integration-First Testing. Adapt to ai-platform-engineering architecture (multi-agent, LangGraph, A2A protocol). Document amendment process.

title: Review GitLab agent PR #580
description: Review and test PR #580: feat: add gitlab agent. Verify implementation follows agent patterns (LangGraph, A2A protocol). Check MCP integration, tool definitions, error handling, and documentation. Test with GitLab API operations. Provide feedback and approve if ready.

title: Add wget_tool for URL fetching with authentication

title: Add read_file_tool for reading files outside workspace
description: Add a tool that can read files from any path (not just workspace), needed for reading files from cloned repos in /tmp/.

title: Refactor: Separate git_tool, wget_tool, and git_clone into distinct tools
description:
## Problem

The current tool organization mixes concerns:
- `git_clone` is bundled with other git operations but has unique authentication needs
- No dedicated `wget_tool` for fetching URLs (currently using `fetch_url` which doesn't handle auth)
- `read_workspace_file` can't read files from cloned repos outside workspace (e.g., `/tmp/`)

## Proposed Refactoring

### 1. git_tool
- `git_status`, `git_log`, `git_diff`, `git_show`, `git_branch`, `git_remote`
- Read-only operations that work within existing repos

### 2. git_clone_tool  
- Dedicated tool for cloning repositories
- Handles GitHub/GitLab token injection
- Returns cloned path for subsequent operations

### 3. wget_tool / fetch_tool
- Fetch URLs with optional authentication
- Support for GitHub/GitLab API endpoints
- Proper token injection for private resources

### 4. read_file_tool (enhanced)
- Read files from any path (not just workspace)
- Needed for reading files from cloned repos in `/tmp/`

## Context
When agent clones to `/tmp/`, subsequent file reads fail because:
- `read_workspace_file` only works within workspace
- `fetch_url` doesn't use auth tokens for private GitHub URLs
- `git_show` should be used but agent doesn't know this

title: UI: Fix auto-scroll resume button appearing during fast streaming
description: Fix bug where resume auto-scroll button keeps popping up when text streams in too fast

title: Integration testing with multi-agent system
description: Test deepagents integration with existing supervisor and platform engineer agents. Verify sub-agent delegation using task() tool works with current architecture. Test TodoListMiddleware execution plans. Verify SummarizationMiddleware handles context overflow (170k tokens). Run full integration test suite.

title: Add curl_tool for HTTP requests with headers and auth
description: Add a curl-like tool for making HTTP requests with custom headers, authentication, and method support (GET, POST, etc.).

title: Dynamic skill and todo list creation using KB
description:
Implement a dynamic system for skill discovery and task planning using a Knowledge Base (KB) that enables agents to dynamically learn capabilities and create structured execution plans.

## Goals
- Build a knowledge base system for storing and retrieving agent skills
- Enable dynamic skill discovery based on task requirements
- Implement intelligent todo list generation from task analysis
- Support skill composition for complex multi-step operations

## Scope
- Knowledge Base implementation for skill definitions and metadata
- Skill matching and discovery algorithms
- Dynamic todo/execution plan generation
- Integration with existing agent supervisor system
- Skill versioning and deprecation handling

## Key Features
- Skill registry with semantic search capabilities
- Automatic skill recommendation based on task context
- Hierarchical todo list generation with dependencies
- Progress tracking and adaptive replanning
- Skill gap identification and reporting

## Success Criteria
- KB can store and retrieve skills efficiently
- Agents can discover relevant skills dynamically
- Todo lists are generated with proper task ordering
- System integrates with multi-agent architecture
- Skill recommendations improve task completion rates

Include rationale, benefits (TodoListMiddleware, FilesystemMiddleware, SubAgentMiddleware, HITL), trade-offs, and implementation approach. Follow ADR template from .cursorrules.

Implement StateBackend for ephemeral working files. Test long-term memory capabilities for user preferences and knowledge bases.

title: Phase 1: MongoDB backend foundation

Acceptance Criteria:
- MongoDB container running in docker-compose

Deliverables:
